availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
The State of Mississippi
DeSoto County

I, G E Harris of the state and County aforesaid, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of my office of commissioner of the state of Kentucky for the state of Mississippi under and by virtue of the laws of Kentucky to the best of my skill and judgment, So help me God

The State of Mississippi
DeSoto County

This day personally appeared before me E Bullington an acting Justice of the peace in and for said County G E Harris, to me well known, who made and subscribed the above and foregoing oath of office Given under my hand and seal this 30th day of June AD 1860

E Bullington
Justice of the peace

The State of Mississippi
Desoto County

I R. R. West clerk of the Probate Court of Said County (which is a Court of Record) do hereby certify that E Bullington Esqr whose genuine Signature appears to the foregoing certificate is and was at the date thereof an acting Justice of the Peace in and for said County duly elected qualified and Commissioned, duly authorized by the laws of the state of Mississippi to administer and certify oaths. &c. and that full faith and credit are due his official acts as Such Justice.
Given under my hand and the seal of said Court at office the 30th June 1860

Mississippi
Comr. of Deed
G. E. Harris
Oath
Filed Nov 21. 1860
